availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Rial LOSER (Hancock County, Kentucky, tailor and merchant)

body.p: Hancock County, Kentucky, tailor and merchant. Native of Germany. Married to Elizabeth Rial. Father of Elizabeth Rial, Mary J. Rial, William Rial, Sarah F. Rial, Phillip Rial, Kate Rial, George Rial, and Edward Rial. Resident engaged in manufacture and trade in Hancock County, Kentucky, in 1840. Tailor in Hancock County in 1850. Merchant in Hancock County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Sixth Manuscript Census of the United States (1840), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Hawesville, p. 3.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 296B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Hawesville, p. 1042.
"William Rial (1809-1869)," Find A Grave, Memorial #89301337, accessed October 15, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/89301337.
